de.lambeck.pned.models.data

Interface IDataModelController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInfo_Status
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataModelController

    public interface IDataModelController
extends IInfo_Status
    Interface for controllers for data models representing a Petri net. This means models with all persistent information (loaded from/saved to files).
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

      • Methods inherited from interface de.lambeck.pned.application.IInfo_Status

        setInfo_Status

    • Method Detail

      • addDataModel

        void addDataModel(java.lang.String modelName,
                  java.lang.String displayName)
        Adds a data model for a non-existing file.

        Note: This is intended to be used to add new models which are not coming from a PNML file (e.g. "Untitled1", "Untitled2"... or "New1", "New2"...)
        Parameters:
        modelName - The full path name of the PNML file
        displayName - The title of the tab (= the file name)

      • addDataModel

        int addDataModel(java.io.File pnmlFile)
        Adds a data model for an existing file.

        Exit codes:
        - ExitCode.OPERATION_SUCCESSFUL: OK
        - ExitCode.OPERATION_FAILED: Error: Could not open the file!
        - ExitCode.OPERATION_CANCELED: Error: Data model not accepted!
        Parameters:
        pnmlFile - The file to use for read-in.
        Returns:
        The exit code

      • isModifiedDataModel

        boolean isModifiedDataModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Checks if the specified data model has been modified.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        Returns:
        True if the model has been modified; otherwise false

      • resetModifiedDataModel

        void resetModifiedDataModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Resets the "modified" state of the specified model.

        Note: Use this method after loading a PNML file because the model has not been changed by the user after adding elements from the PNML file only.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • removeDataModel

        void removeDataModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Removes the specified data model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • renameDataModel

        void renameDataModel(IDataModel model,
                     java.lang.String newModelName,
                     java.lang.String newDisplayName)
        Renames the specified IDataModel. (Use this in case the user has saved the file under a new file name.)
        Parameters:
        model - The IDataModel
        newModelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        newDisplayName - The title of the tab (= the file name)

      • getDataModel

        IDataModel getDataModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Returns the specified IDataModel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        Returns:
        The specified data model

      • getCurrentModel

        IDataModel getCurrentModel()
        Returns the current (active) IDataModel of the DataModelController.
        Returns:
        The DataModel

      • setCurrentModel

        void setCurrentModel(IDataModel model)
        Sets the specified IDataModel as current (active) model of the DataModelController.
        Parameters:
        model - The specified IDataModel

      • getValidationMessagePanel

        IValidationMsgPanel getValidationMessagePanel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Returns the validation message panel for a file name.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        Returns:
        The IValidationMsgPanel

      • getModifiedDataModels

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getModifiedDataModels()
        Returns a list of data models which have been modified and need to be saved.

        Note: The model names (String) because they have to match with the names of the open files.
        Returns:
        List of modified data models

      • addPlaceToCurrentDataModel

        void addPlaceToCurrentDataModel(java.lang.String id,
                                EPlaceToken initialTokens,
                                java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a place to the current data model.

        Intended use: adding a place after a GUI event when the new place is without a name after creation.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of this place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addPlaceToCurrentDataModel

        void addPlaceToCurrentDataModel(java.lang.String id,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                EPlaceToken initialTokens,
                                java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a place to the current data model.

        Note: Adds an additional parameter name to the other method addPlaceToCurrentModel(String id, EPlaceToken initialTokens, Point position)

        Intended use: adding a place after reading from a PNML file because these places may have a name.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        name - The name of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of this place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addTransitionToCurrentDataModel

        void addTransitionToCurrentDataModel(java.lang.String id,
                                     java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a transition to the current data model.

        Intended use: adding a transition after a GUI event when the new transition is without a name after creation.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the transition
        position - The position (center) of the transition

      • addTransitionToCurrentDataModel

        void addTransitionToCurrentDataModel(java.lang.String id,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a transition to the current data model.

        Note: Adds an additional parameter name to the other method addTransitionToCurrentModel(String id, Point position)

        Intended use: adding a transition after reading from a PNML file because these transitions may have a name.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the transition
        name - The name of the transition
        position - The position (center) of the transition

      • addArcToCurrentDataModel

        void addArcToCurrentDataModel(java.lang.String id,
                              java.lang.String sourceId,
                              java.lang.String targetId)
        Adds an arc to the current data model.

        Note: This method should be the same for GUI events and reading from a PNML file because arcs will have all 3 attributes in either cases.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the arc
        sourceId - The id of the source (Place or Transition)
        targetId - The id of the target (Place or Transition)

      • renameNode

        void renameNode(java.lang.String nodeId,
                java.lang.String newName)
        Handles the application controllers request to rename a node in the data model. (After the node in the GUI was renamed.)
        Parameters:
        nodeId - The id of the node
        newName - The new name

      • removeDataElement

        void removeDataElement(java.lang.String elementId)
        Handles the application controllers info to remove an element from the data model.
        Parameters:
        elementId - The id of the element

      • removeElementFromCurrentDataModel

        void removeElementFromCurrentDataModel(java.lang.String id)
                                throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Removes the specified element from the current data model.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the element
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if element does not exist

      • clearCurrentDataModel

        void clearCurrentDataModel()
        Removes all elements from the current data model.

              java.awt.Point newPosition)
        Handles the application controllers request to update the position of a node in the data model.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - The id of the node
        newPosition - The new position

      • resetAllDataStartPlaces

        void resetAllDataStartPlaces(java.lang.String modelName)
        Callback for the StartPlacesValidator to reset all start places.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • resetAllDataEndPlaces

        void resetAllDataEndPlaces(java.lang.String modelName)
        Callback for the EndPlacesValidator to reset all end places.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • setDataStartPlace

        void setDataStartPlace(java.lang.String modelName,
                       java.lang.String placeId,
                       boolean b)
        Callback for the StartPlacesValidator to set the specified DataPlace as the real (unambiguous) start place.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the DataPlace
        b - True to set as the real (unambiguous) start place; otherwise false

      • setDataStartPlaceCandidate

        void setDataStartPlaceCandidate(java.lang.String modelName,
                                java.lang.String placeId,
                                boolean b)
        Callback for the StartPlacesValidator to set the specified DataPlace as a start place candidate.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the DataPlace
        b - True to set as a start place candidate; otherwise false

      • setDataEndPlace

        void setDataEndPlace(java.lang.String modelName,
                     java.lang.String placeId,
                     boolean b)
        Callback for the EndPlacesValidator to set the specified DataPlace as the real (unambiguous) end place.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the DataPlace
        b - True to set as the real (unambiguous) end place; otherwise false

      • setDataEndPlaceCandidate

        void setDataEndPlaceCandidate(java.lang.String modelName,
                              java.lang.String placeId,
                              boolean b)
        Callback for the EndPlacesValidator to set the specified DataPlace as an end place candidate.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the DataPlace
        b - True to set as an end place candidate; otherwise false

      • highlightUnreachableDataNode

        void highlightUnreachableDataNode(java.lang.String modelName,
                                  java.lang.String nodeId,
                                  boolean b)
        Callback for the AllNodesOnPathsValidator to highlight nodes that cannot be reached from the start place or cannot reach the end place.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        nodeId - The id of the IDataNode
        b - True = unreachable; False = can be reached from the start place and can reach the end place

      • removeAllDataTokens

        void removeAllDataTokens(java.lang.String modelName)
        Removes the token from all DataPlace in the specified data model.

        Intended use: After structural changes in the model
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • addDataToken

        void addDataToken(java.lang.String modelName,
                  java.util.List<java.lang.String> placesWithToken)
        Adds a token to all specified DataPlace in the specified data model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placesWithToken - A List of type String with the IDs of the specified places

      • resetAllDataTransitionsEnabledState

        void resetAllDataTransitionsEnabledState(java.lang.String modelName)
        Resets the "enabled" state for all IDataTransition in the specified data model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • setGuiTransitionUnsafe

        void setGuiTransitionUnsafe(java.lang.String modelName,
                            java.lang.String transitionId)
        Callback for the EnabledTransitionsValidator to set the "safe" state for the specified IGuiTransition in the specified IGuiModel to false.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        transitionId - The id of the IGuiTransition

      • setGuiTransitionEnabled

        void setGuiTransitionEnabled(java.lang.String modelName,
                             java.lang.String transitionId)
        Callback for the EnabledTransitionsValidator to set the "enabled" state for the specified IGuiTransition in the specified IGuiModel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        transitionId - The id of the IGuiTransition

      • fireDataTransition

        void fireDataTransition(java.lang.String transitionId)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to fire a transition.

        Note: This refers to the current model (active file).
        Parameters:
        transitionId - The id of the IDataTransition

      • stopSimulation

        void stopSimulation()
        Resets the current state of tokens and enabled transitions.
